Plot a report of the data available for a sample.

Source: R/plot_sample.R
plot_sample.Rd

This function creates a multi-plot figure from different visualizations available in `evoverse`, and in the other packages that `evoverse` interfaces with. The plot is assembled using functions from two packages: cowplot and ggpubr.

The plot regards only one sample in the dataset, and shows:

  • The histogram of the variant allele frequency (VAF) for the sample;

  • The histogram of the depth (DP) for the sample;

  • The histogram of the number of reads with the variant (NV) for the sample;

  • The joint scatter of DP against VAF;

  • The copy number segments, plot via the CNAqc package available at https://github.com/caravagn/CNAqc.

plot_sample(x, sample, N_CNA = 10000)

Arguments

x

An evoverse object.
sample

The sample to plot.
N_CNA

The number of mutations to plot in the CNA segment panel. This parameter is passed to the plotting functions of the CNAqc package. By default up to 10,000 mutations are shown.

Value

A figure assembled from several ggplot objects, combined with functions from the cowplot and ggpubr packages.

Examples

data('example_evoverse')
#> Warning: data set ‘example_evoverse’ not found

# Plot the data
plot_sample(example_evoverse, sample = example_evoverse$samples[1])
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
#> Warning: Removed 26959 rows containing missing values (geom_point).

# Plot the data - only 100 mutations in the segments plot, faster rendering
plot_sample(example_evoverse, sample = example_evoverse$samples[1], N_CNA = 100)
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
#> Warning: Removed 26959 rows containing missing values (geom_point).
